txtVar_1.text: Time and a managed proofing process ensure the unique Papa John’s taste of the original dough.

txtVar_2.text: Newer dough that has not fully proofed has a bland taste and a dense texture.

txtVar_3.text: Older dough, or dough that has been overproofed, tastes slightly sour and has a course texture.

text:
Have you ever wondered how Papa John’s maintains the unique flavor of its original dough? It takes time and a managed proofing process for Papa John’s original dough to develop its unique Papa John’s taste that our customers love.

Time is important because newer dough that has not fully proofed tends to have a bland taste and a dense texture.

Older dough, or dough that has been overproofed, tends to taste slightly sour with a course texture.
